intro: Mesochlaena javanica, commonly known as the Javanese mesochlaena, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetland and swampy areas, showing a preference for moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, contributing to its ornamental value.
